notes: Essential tempering spice, pungent flavor.
Jeera, key spice for tempering and digestion.

Saunf, digestive and mouth freshener.
Methi seeds, bitter earthy flavor.
King of spices, adds heat and aroma.

Strong, pungent spice used in Garam Masala.
Sweet woody spice, used in desserts and curries.
Haldi, essential for color and antiseptic properties.
Adds heat and color to dishes.
Creamy nut used in rich gravies and sweets.
Nutrient-rich nut, used in desserts and badam milk.
Used in garnishing sweets and desserts.
Brain food, rich in Omega-3.
Dried grapes, used in Kheer and desserts.
Natural sweetener, rich in energy.
Sour pulp used in Sambar and Rasam.
Sour fruit rind used in coastal curries.
Hing, strong aroma, digestive aid.
Khus Khus, thickens gravies.
Ajwain, good for digestion.
Kalonji, onion seeds for flavor.
Sabja, cooling seeds for drinks.
Magaz, thickens rich gravies.
Kesar, most expensive spice, for color/aroma.
Jaiphal, warm sweet spice.
Javitri, outer covering of Nutmeg.
Flower-shaped spice with licorice flavor.
Tej Patta, aromatic leaf for tempering.
Sonth, used in powders and tea.
Badi Elaichi, smoky flavor for curries.
Milder than black pepper, for white sauces.
Pippali, distinct spicy flavor.

Kapok buds, used in Bisi Bele Bath.
Cubeb pepper/Allspice, aromatic.
